Package net.objectzoo.delegates

Interface FunctionAsync<T,​R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the FunctionAsync's parameter
    R - The type of the FunctionAsync's return value
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FunctionAsyncSupport, FunctionToFunctionAsync
    public interface FunctionAsync<T,​R>
    A FunctionAsync is a reference to a function with return value that can be invoked asynchronously in another thread. With FunctionAsync it is possible to track the status and outcome using the FunctionAsyncResult returned upon invocation or by defining a Consumer as callback for the invocation.
    Author:
    tilmann

        static <T,​R> FunctionAsync<T,​R> from​(java.util.function.Function<T,​R> function)
        Converts the given Function to the interface FunctionAsync using the default executor. Conversion is done using the adapter FunctionToFunctionAsync.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Function's parameter
        R - The type of the Function's return value
        Parameters:

      • from

        static <T,​R> FunctionAsync<T,​R> from​(java.util.function.Function<T,​R> function,
                                                 java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Converts the given Function to the interface FunctionAsync and executes asynchronous call using the given Executor. Conversion is done using the adapter FunctionToFunctionAsync.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Function's parameter
        R - The type of the Function's return value
        Parameters:
        function - the action to be converted
        executor - the executor used for the asynchronous calls
        Returns:
        the converted function

      • beginApply

        FunctionAsyncResult<R> beginApply​(java.util.function.Consumer<? super FunctionAsyncResult<R>> callback,
                                  java.lang.Object asyncState,
                                  T parameter)
        Asynchronously invoke this FunctionAsync with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.

        Associated with each call to beginInvoke is a FunctionAsyncResult instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the FunctionAsync's invocation and receives the same FunctionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations FunctionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        parameter - the parameter value for the invocation
        Returns:
        the FunctionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
